body.p: To His Excellency the Governor of Kentucky.

Your petitioner John Carpenter states that at the Augt Term of the Garrard Circuit Court 1860, he was indicted by the Grand jury for carrying on his person a concealed deadly weapon in 1860, & at the February Term of Said Court ^1861^ he was fined $52- for said offence by the Judgt of the Garrard Circuit Court.

He states that the reason he carried weapons were that his life had been threatened & he in good faith believed that his person was in danger & carried weapons to defend himself, & he believed his safety required it, & he proved a clear defense on the trial, & the party who threatened him to his utter astonishment, in the trial denied the threats, & in his testimony the judgt was obtained
Wherefore he prays your excellency to remit said fine.
John Carpenter says he believes the statements of the foregoing petition are true.
Sworn to before me by John Carpenter this 18th of March 1861.

Thomas P. Hewitt Notary Public
Garrard County Ky
I was present at the trial of the trial petitioner & heard the testimony & I am clearly of opinion that the fine ought to be remitted

Garrard Cir Ct
John Carpenter
